intro: Oxystophyllum minutigibbum, commonly known as the tiny-groined oxystophyllum, is a rare and delicate plant species belonging to the family Oxystophylleaceae. It is characterized by its small, intricate leaves that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
